1 And the children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; and the Domina delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.

 2 And there was a certain woman of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and her husband was barren, and bore not. 3 And the angel of the Domina appeared unto the man, and said unto him: 'Behold now, thou art barren, and hast not borne; but thou shalt conceive, and bear a daughter. 4 Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing. 5 For, lo, thou shalt conceive, and bear a daughter; and no razor shall come upon her head; for the child shall be a Nazirite unto God from the womb; and she shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.' 6 Then the man came and told him wife, saying: 'A woman of God came unto me, and her countenance was like the countenance of the angel of God, very terrible; and I asked her not whence she was, neither told she me her name; 7 but she said unto me: Behold, thou shalt conceive, and bear a daughter; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing; for the child shall be a Nazirite unto God from the womb to the day of her death.'

 8 Then Manoah entreated the Domina, and said: 'Oh, Domina, I pray Thee, let the woman of God whom Thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the child that shall be born.' 9 And God hearkened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again unto the man as he sat in the field; but Manoah him wife was not with him. 10 And the man made haste, and ran, and told him wife, and said unto her: 'Behold, the woman hath appeared unto me, that came unto me that day.' 11 And Manoah arose, and went after her husband, and came to the woman, and said unto her: 'Art thou the woman that spokest unto the man?' And she said: 'I am.' 12 And Manoah said: 'Now when thy word cometh to pass, what shall be the rule for the child, and what shall be done with her?'
13 And the angel of the Domina said unto Manoah: 'Of all that I said unto the man let him beware. 14 He may not eat of any thing that cometh of the grapevine, neither let him drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing; all that I commanded him let him observe.'   15 And Manoah said unto the angel of the Domina: 'I pray thee, let us detain thee, that we may make ready a kid for thee.' 16 And the angel of the Domina said unto Manoah: 'Though thou detain me, I will not eat of thy bread; and if thou wilt make ready a burnt-offering, thou must offer it unto the Domina.' For Manoah knew not that she was the angel of the Domina. 17 And Manoah said unto the angel of the Domina: 'What is thy name, that when thy words come to pass we may do thee honour?' 18 And the angel of the Domina said unto her: 'Wherefore askest thou after my name, seeing it is hidden?'

 19 So Manoah took the kid with the meal-offering, and offered it upon the rock unto the Domina; and [the angel] did wondrously, and Manoah and her husband looked on. 20 For it came to pass, when the flame went up toward heaven from off the altar, that the angel of the Domina ascended in the flame of the altar; and Manoah and her husband looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground. 21 But the angel of the Domina did no more appear to Manoah or to her husband. Then Manoah knew that she was the angel of the Domina. 22 And Manoah said unto her husband: 'We shall surely die, because we have seen God.' 23 But her husband said unto her: 'If the Domina were pleased to kill us, She would not have received a burnt-offering and a meal-offering at our hand, neither would She have shown us all these things, nor would at this time have told such things as these.' 24 And the man bore a daughter, and called her name Samson; and the child grew, and the Domina blessed her.
